author: Special Correspondent
text:
An aged woman sustained severe burns after an abandoned wooden box kept in front of her house exploded when she tried to open it. The incident took place at Neikuppai village on Thursday evening.

The woman, R. Muthammal (72), who was admitted to the Perambalur Government Hospital, was later referred to the Mahatma Gandhi Memorial Government Hospital in Tiruchi. Senior police officers headed by the Superintendent of Police Sonal Chandra rushed to the spot and conducted enquiries. Police sources said two persons on a motorcycle and wearing helmet came near the house of Muthammal and reportedly placed a wooden box in front of her residence in the afternoon.

Upon noticing the box kept in front of her house, the woman tried to open it when it exploded causing her severe burns, the sources said. Scientific assistants were pressed into service to find out the nature of the substance that exploded. The aged woman sustained injuries on her face, legs, and hands. V. Kalathur police are investigating.
title: Aged woman injured as box explodes
